channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Prosecution Of Daniel Penny Is A Soviet-Style Attack On The Right Of Self-Defense
item.description: The prosecution of Daniel Penny fits a pattern that the Soviet-era Russian writer Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn would have recognized and detailed.

item.title: The Biden-Harris ATF Has Gun Shops in Its Crosshairs
item.description: The administration has launched a war of attrition against the vendors who make Americans’ Second Amendment rights effective.

item.title: Conservatives Fear Arizona House Committee Shakeup Could Stymie Election Integrity Bills
item.description: 'You cannot 'Make America Great Again' without securing our elections,' said Merissa Hamilton.

item.title: University of Austin weeds out DEI, replaces it with merit-based initiatives: VP
item.description: The University of Austin, focusing on free speech and debate, replaces DEI with merit-based values, aiming to counter modern campus culture issues.

item.title: Harris campaign leaders: 'Price to be paid' for shortened 107-day campaign against Trump
item.description: The leaders of Kamala Harris' presidential campaign insist they simply didn't have enough time to execute a winning strategy against Donald Trump.

item.title: The New York Times Gets the University of Florida Wrong
item.description: The paper of record mischaracterizes recent efforts to reform Florida’s flagship state university.

item.title: Reining In the AI Regulators
item.description: Government should err on the side of caution when it comes to regulatory intervention in nascent industries like AI.

item.title: Parents Appeal To U.S. Supreme Court After Vermont Courts Ruled Schools Can Vaccinate Kids Against Parents’ Wishes
item.description: All American children are constitutionally entitled to the protections of informed parental consent.

item.title: Say No to the National Suicide Service
item.description: We urge the Parliament of the United Kingdom to reject the Terminally Ill Adults (End of Life) Bill.

item.title: Kerry suggests Africans without electricity must pick 'the right kinds of electricity'
item.description: John Kerry suggests Africans without electricity should "choose the right kinds of electricity," and the U.S. should help them pay for it.
